comments.body: seems worse to make every random API server enumerate these (and keep up with new options we want to be able to use consistently in all API servers)

> seems worse to make every random API server enumerate these (and keep up with new options we want to be able to use consistently in all API servers)

In practice, this works out much better.  Not all API servers want the same thing.

We should discourage insecureServingInfo, most won't need use these authentication options, the first I built didn't need etcd, and even more of the remaining options are rare.  Having three buckets or so works much better.  If we want to combine them later we can, but even so these building blocks are useful for the first examples we have, so I'm disinclined to bundle them all.
